Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): Enable pipe information when checkTypeOfPipes‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶=false

When `checkTypeOfPipes` is set to `false`, the configuration is meant to
ignore the signature of the pipe's `transform` method for diagnostics.
However, we still should produce some information about the pipe for the
`TemplateTypeChecker`. This change refactors the returned symbol for
pipes so that it also includes information about the pipe's class
instance as it appears in the TCB.

Issues.Title: ngcc deep import warnings for generated types
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli ### Is this a regression? Probably not a regression. ### Description We have two repositories, both full of Angular libraries. Both repositories have generated typings in the root folder called `generated` which is ignored by git. Libraries from one repository depend on libraries of another (one direction only). What happens is that once we install certain library, that library expects `generated` path with typings inside. This actually works perfectly fine, but ngcc throws warning like: ``` WARNING in Entry point ‚Äòlibrary/name‚Äô contains deep imports into ‚Äòabsolute-path/generated/globalTypes.d.ts‚Äô. This is probably not a problem, but may cause the compilation of entry points to be out of order ``` Additionally we use TS Paths in order for ngcc to recognize the folder in the first place: ``` "generated/*": [ "generated/*" ], ``` First workaround is to silence the warning with the snippet bellow, but we would have to repeat the entry for each and every library we produce. ```js // ngcc.config.js module.exports = { packages: { 'library/name': { ignorableDeepImportMatchers: [ /generated\//, ] }, }, }; ``` Second workaround would be to release `ngcc.config.js` with each library, looking like: ```js module.exports = { ignorableDeepImportMatchers: [/generated\//] }; ``` and add `ngcc.config.js` to assets of `ng-package.json`: ```json { "$schema": "../../node_modules/ng-packagr/ng-package.schema.json", "dest": "../../dist/library/name", "assets": ["./ngcc.config.js"] } ``` Third workaround is to use `impor type` syntax for all generated types: ```ts import type { MyType } from 'generated'; ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This would take a massive effort to reproduce. I will attempt on doing so if we cannot proceed verbally only. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 10.2.0
Node: 12.18.2
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.2.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... elements, forms, language-service, localize
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
... service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Angular i18n generates one trans-unit where two are needed.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Never worked. ### Description When using icu for pluralisation the context of the words get lost. Some translations for the same words differ based on context. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction What you first need to know: **German / English** Person / person Personen /¬†persons Use in your project: ```html

{items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}} gehen unwiderruflich verloren.

``` And somewhere else: ```html

Entferne {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}}

``` Note that the first letter of the noun is uppercase in german. No matter if it‚Äôs the beginning of a sentence or not. Generate translation files and translate them. You will get three nodes. Something linke this: ```html gehen unwiderruflich verloren. will be lost permanently. ``` ```html Entferne Remove ``` ```html {VAR_PLURAL, plural, one {Person} other {Person} } {VAR_PLURAL, plural, one { ‚ùì‚ùì‚ùì } other { ‚ùì‚ùì‚ùì } } ``` Problem: First sentence would need the translation `{VAR_PLURAL, plural, one {Person} other {Persons} }` Second sentence would need the translation `{VAR_PLURAL, plural, one {person} other {persons} }` I expected two trans-units. Something like this: ```html {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}} gehen unwiderruflich verloren. {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Persons}} will be lost permanently. ``` and ```html Entferne {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Personen}} Remove {items.length, plural, one {Person} other {Persons}} ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.12
Node: 10.16.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.12
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.9

**Anything else relevant?** [@ocombe announced](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/25858#issuecomment-420191396) that the ivy release will fix this. But people [decided to not ship this](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/25858#issuecomment-707269234) in order to to _make Ivy more backwards compatible_.

Issues.Title: OWASP ZAP scanner show Medium risk vulnerability
Issues.Body:
Our regular security scan includes a ZAP task where we manually test our applications in the tool. We remained with one issue we can't solve in-house is with the generated vendor.js file for development builds.

Relevant report snippet:

### Alert Detail

Medium (Medium) | Application Error Disclosure
-- | --
Description | This page contains an error/warning message that may disclose sensitive information like the location of the file that produced the unhandled exception. This information can be used to launch further attacks against the web application. The alert could be a false positive if the error message is found inside a documentation page.
¬†
URL | https://dev-url/vendor-es2015.js
Method | GET
Evidence | internal error
Instances | 1
Solution | Review the source code of this page. Implement custom error pages. Consider implementing a mechanism to provide a unique error reference/identifier to the client (browser) while logging the details on the server side and not exposing them to the user.
Reference | ¬†
CWE Id | 200
WASC Id | 13
Source ID | 3

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34339979/98001180-a0f81680-1ded-11eb-88d5-a56ef991a293.png)

Do you have an idea how to work around this issue?

ZAP Version: 2.9.0 (latest)
Angular version: 8.2.14 (but the code snippet is in v11 as well)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "OWASP ZAP scanner show Medium risk vulnerability" (#39550)

Issues.Title: Reactive Forms guide could be more precise on HTML5 native validators
Issues.Body:
In the [Reactive Forms guide](https://angular.io/guide/reactive-forms), a user is encouraged to use native HTML5 attributes for validation such as `required`, `minlength` or `maxlength`. However, the default behavior of Angular reactive form is that it adds `novalidate` attribute to the form, which prevents native validators from functioning. 

To prevent misunderstanding, I would suggest adding information, that in order for HTML5 validators to work properly, one needs to add `ngNativeValidate` directive to the form.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reactive Forms guide could be more precise on HTML5 native validators" (#39549)

Issues.Title: Option to specify schematics to install and run during new project creation
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

Ability to specify schematics to install and run during new project creation with `ng new`


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Use case example: I want to start a new project and have angular material, cdk, and ngrx installed and setup right after the project been bootstrapped.


### Describe the solution you'd like

```
ng new my-project --schematics=@angular/material,@angular/cdk,@ngrx/store
```

If the schematics have interactive setup scripts after installation, run the interactive installation scripts in the order defined in the `--schematics` option (the name for the options might not be appropriate, maybe pick a more explicit name for the option?)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Option to specify schematics to install and run during new project creation" (#19302)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): library generation on a solution-styled project
Issues.Body:
Solution Styled projects depends of `tsconfig.base.json`,  and when the new library paths has to be added, an unhandled exception is thrown (compilerOptions is not part of `tsconfig.json`)

this PR tries first to update `tsconfig.base.json`, and if it doesn't exists, fallback to the `tsconfig.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): library generation on a solution-styled project" (#19303)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **compiler-cli:** report missing pipes when `fullTemplateTypeCheck` is disabled ([#​39320](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39320)) ([71d0063](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/71d0063)), closes [#​38195](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38195)
-   **core:** markDirty() should only mark flags when really scheduling tick. ([#​39316](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39316)) ([8c82106](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/8c82106)), closes [#​39296](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39296)
-   **router:** Ensure all outlets are used when commands have a prefix ([#​39456](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39456)) ([85d5242](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/85d5242))

##### Performance Improvements

-   **core:** do not recurse into modules that have already been registered ([#​39514](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39514)) ([812355c](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/812355c)), closes [#​39487](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39487)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): correctly read transitive dependency
Issues.Body:

dependencies and tries to parse the containing directory as JSON. This PR
fixes this by providing the correct path to the package.json.

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>blesh/symbol-observable</summary>

### [`v3.0.0`](https://togithub.com/blesh/symbol-observable/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​300-httpsgithubcombleshsymbol-observablecompare203300-2020-11-02)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/blesh/symbol-observable/compare/2.0.3...6b9ca7f1891b0e79170299dc071a6ad923afb5d3)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **TypeScript:** `Symbol.observable` is now `unique symbol`. ([2ef1476](https://togithub.com/blesh/symbol-observable/commit/2ef147644cf78538b28c3fd9e66a3b8d569a1978)), closes [#​41](https://togithub.com/blesh/symbol-observable/issues/41)
-   **TypeScript:** `Symbol[Symbol.observable]` is no longer incorrectly defined ([fe4301f](https://togithub.com/blesh/symbol-observable/commit/fe4301f37b54162e1a2db91e79c5b33d652496f1))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **TypeScript:** Older versions of `@types/node` will clash with this, because `@types/node` incorrectly defined `Symbol.observable` has `symbol` and not `unique symbol`. Update to `@types/node@14.14.6` or higher.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove `sourceMappingURL` from vendor modules
Issues.Body:
With this change we add a loader that removes the `//# sourceMappingURL=` comment from `.js` files.
Webpack will not remove these comments when the chunk that these mules are in, are excluded from `SourceMapDevToolPlugin`.

Closes #19236

Issues.Title: CLI 11.0.0-rc.1 [WDS] Disconnected! and net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [ ] new - [ ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 11.0.0-rc.0 *(I think)* ### Description A freshly project created using 11.0.0-rc.1 of the CLI shows errors in the console when when viewing the application while using `ng serve`. HMR doesn't work. Application will not reload on recompile. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new ng11 ? Do you want to enforce stricter type checking and stricter bundle budgets in the workspace? This setting helps improve maintainability and catch bugs ahead of time. For more information, see https://angular.io/strict No ? Would you like to add Angular routing? No ? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? CSS cd ng11 ng s -o ``` ## üî• Exception or Error Browser console output:

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): unable to move focus from inside opened event
Issues.Body:
We move focus inside the menu after we've dispatched the `menuOpened` event which means that we'll override any focus that the consumer may have set inside the handler. These changes fix the issue by changing the order.

Fixes #20965.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/menu): unable to move focus from inside opened event" (#20968)

2. Apply style into css: `@import '~@angular/material-experimental/mdc-checkbox/checkbox-theme';`

It seems a reverted PR may reintroduce a broken path in the mdc-checkbox style

  src/styles.scss 16:9                                                               root stylesheet ```

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/a11y): allow for origin of already focused element to be changed
Issues.Body:
The way `FocusMonitor.focusVia` works is by calling `focus` on the specified element and waiting for a `focus` event to trigger so the origin is applied. The problem is that if `focusVia` is called on an element that already has focus, the event won't be dispatched and the origin won't be updated which can cause the UI to look stuck.

These changes make it so that if we detect that an element is focused already, we update its classes and dispatch the relevant event without trying to focus it.

Related to #20965.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/a11y): allow for origin of already focused element to be changed" (#20966)

Issues.Title: fix(material/checkbox): set display on host node
Issues.Body:
Currently the host nodes are `display: inline` by default which doesn't allow for things like `margin` and `width` to be set. These changes switch to `inline-block` which is a bit more flexible.

Fixes #20954.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/checkbox): set display on host node" (#20961)

Issues.Title: MatCheckbox should be `display: inline-block`
Issues.Body: Currently `<mat-checkbox>` is `display: inline`. This means that things like margin, height, width, etc. won't apply to it. The element should be `display: inline-block`. The MDC version also has this problem. We may decide to only fix this in the MDC version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatCheckbox should be `display: inline-block`" (#20954)

Issues.Title: feat(material): grid system missing in `@angular/material`
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Hi,
Angular material is listed for example in [this article](https://medium.com/@dharmendraoist/19-best-angular-ui-frameworks-to-use-for-faster-development-in-2020-b50e8e8c5072) as the most used and top ui lib. for angular. I personally like it üëç 

If i compare `@angular/material` to `ngx-bootstrap` or `ng-prime` or even `salesforce`. I see a missing part 'the grid system'.
bootstrap: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/
prime: https://www.primefaces.org/primeng-flexgrid/
salesforce/lightning: http://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/utilities/grid/

material.io website describes a [grid system here](https://material.io/design/layout/responsive-layout-grid.html).

The request:
 If it's `@angular/flex-layout` then it should be linked in the documentation of the github repo. as official grid-system.
Or **I think personally that `@angular/material` should add it's own with css classes and not directives => like other libs do.**

side notes:
- https://blog.logrocket.com/css-grid-or-css-frameworks/
Css grid is not used everywhere. A lot incorp. are still using a grid system from css-frameworks.

- I see some teams in companies **including bootstrap only for the grid system** on top of `@angular/material`.

Thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(material): grid system missing in `@angular/material`" (#20950)

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): screen readers announcing placeholder twice in some cases
Issues.Body:
When a form field is in legacy mode and it doesn't have a label, it'll promote the input placeholder to the label which will cause screen readers to read out the same text twice. These changes clear the chip input placeholder if it's placed in such a form field, similarly to how we do it for `MatInput`.

Fixes #20761.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/chips): screen readers announcing placeholder twice in some cases" (#20945)
